patterns: What are the food options on North Campus?
I'm hungry, where should I go?
hmm i dont know, what do you think?
responses: If you're in the mood for fresh sushi, Champa Sushi in the Student Union is a must-try! They also have Asian snacks and drinks.
Craving something sweet and refreshing? Head over to Jamba for freshly blended smoothies and acai bowls in the Student Union!
For delicious Mexican flavors, check out Moe’s for burritos, tacos, and more!
Need a coffee fix? Tim Horton’s serves hot, fresh coffee and a variety of baked goods like muffins and doughnuts.
Feeling like pasta? Bravo Pasta offers delicious pasta dishes and hot paninis from the Bread Box Deli.
Grab a quick meal at Bulls on the Run, where you can find salads, sandwiches, and snacks to go!
Capen Cafe is perfect for a quick breakfast or light lunch, featuring grab-and-go sandwiches and refreshing beverages.
If you're looking for Kosher options, the NY Deli & Diner in Talbert Hall has delicious falafel and hummus along with vegan and vegetarian dishes.
Check out One World Café for a diverse menu, including Mediterranean, Indian, American, and Asian cuisines all in one spot!
For a cozy spot, Whisper’s Cafe inside Capen Hall has Starbucks beverages, baked goods, and grab-and-go sandwiches and salads.

patterns: Where can I get vegan food?
responses: The NY Deli & Diner in Talbert Hall offers many vegan and vegetarian dishes.

patterns: Where can I get vegetarian food?
responses: Subway in the Commons allows you to customize your sandwich with vegetarian ingredients.
Freshens at Alumni Arena also provides vegetarian salads and bowls.
The Union Market offers vegetarian sushi and other grab-and-go items.

patterns: Where can I get gluten-free food?
responses: Freshens at Alumni Arena offers gluten-free grain bowls and salads.
You can find gluten-free soy sauce at Champa Sushi.
You can also find gluten-free snacks and grab-and-go options at the Union Market.
Gluten-free sliced bread, bagels, sub rolls, and muffins are available at the Dining Centers and Retail Operations.
If you’re in the mood for pasta, Bravo Pasta offers gluten-free pasta options.
Craving pizza? Check out the gluten-free pizza at the Dining Centers.
Don’t miss out on gluten-free waffles at the Dining Centers for breakfast!
For a sweet treat, grab some gluten-free cookies from the Dining Centers.

patterns: Where can I eat with a nut allergy?
responses: Try out the Simple Kitchen! It's an access-controlled pantry for Bulls with food allergy concerns and dietary needs.
The Simple Kitchen pantry is free from foods containing wheat, gluten, peanuts, tree nuts, fish, and shellfish.

patterns: I don't want to spend much
Where can I eat for cheap on North Campus?
responses: You can grab a snack or sandwich at the Union Market for a low-cost meal.
Tim Hortons has inexpensive coffee, donuts, and sandwiches if you're in the Commons.
Young Chow offers chinese meals at relatively low costs!

patterns: What's the wait time at Moe's?

responses: The wait time at Moe’s is typically around 15-25 minutes during lunch hours.
Moe's usually has a moderate wait time of 15 minutes, depending on the time of day.

responses: Tim Hortons can have an average wait during peak times, usually no more than 30 minutes.
The wait at Tim Hortons is typically about 15-20 minutes.

How long is the wait at Jamba Juice in Alumni Arena?
responses: Jamba Juice usually has a short wait time, around 5 minutes.
You can expect a quick wait at Jamba Juice, typically no more than 5 minutes.

patterns: Where can I get Mexican food?

responses: For Mexican food, head to Moe’s Southwest Grill in the Commons.
Moe’s Southwest Grill offers customizable burritos, tacos, and more with a Mexican flair.
Moe’s offers delicious burritos, quesadillas, tacos, and more! It’s a great spot for Mexican food on campus.

patterns: Where's the best place for coffee on campus?
responses: For coffee, you can visit Starbucks at Capen Café, or Tim Hortons in the Commons.
Starbucks and Tim Hortons in the Commons are popular spots for coffee on campus.
Whisper's Cafe at the Silverman Library inside Capen Hall offers hand-crafted Starbucks beverages and freshly-brewed coffees.

responses: Champa Sushi in the Student Union for some fresh sushi!
You can find fresh sushi at Champa Sushi!
You have to try Champa Sushi. They offer fresh sushi, and refreshing Asian snacks and drinks to go along with it.

patterns: Where's the best place for salad?

Moe’s offers fresh salads along with their burritos and tacos.
Capen Cafe has grab-and-go salads if you're looking for something quick.

One World Café has a variety of fresh salad options among their international dishes.

Find grab-and-go sandwiches and salads at the Whisper's Cafe!
